result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius James Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Domestic Abuse Enhancer on Count 1 Dismissed on State's motion. 

State law REQUIRES a DNA sample be provided and payment of DNA surcharge for every criminal offense committed after April 1, 2015. 

To make reasonable efforts to obtain/maintain full time employment. 

To complete AODA assessment & follow up.

To complete treatment per Agent.

Absolute sobriety.  No bars/taverns.  Not to use/possess alcohol. 

No possession of firearms.

No contact with victim except through 3rd party contact with Agent regarding child custody.

If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
